_comment: Created by NCODowd on 07/07/2016 12:50:27 using v2.7
title: How many patients are affected by delayed transfers by the type of care they received?
analysis_commentary: The overall pattern seen in the number of patients experiencing a delayed transfer of care is not replicated across both types of care patients received. From August 2010 to April 2016, there was a 20% increase in the number of patients who experienced a delayed transfer of care: an absolute increase of 984 patients. The number of patients in non-acute care who experienced a delayed transfer actually decreased by 17% (403 patients) in this time period. The overall increase was due to a 54% (1,387 patients) increase in the transfer of acute care patients.
